010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
015
016/**
017 * A non-linear mapping that produces a ripple effect.
018 * The transformation is implicitly inverted, i.e., maps target to source image
019 * coordinates.
020 * Note: This class has been deprecated and substituted by an ImageJ plugin
021 * ("Geometric_Operations.Map_Ripple" in "imagingbook-plugins-book").
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 *
025 */
026@Deprecated     // moved to demo plugins
027public class RippleMapping implements Mapping2D {
028        final double xWavel; // = 20;
029        final double yWavel ; // = 100;
030        final double xAmpl ; // = 0;
031        final double yAmpl ; // = 10;
032   
033        public RippleMapping (double xWavel, double xAmpl, double yWavel, double yAmpl) {
034                this.xWavel = xWavel;
035                this.yWavel = yWavel;
036                this.xAmpl = xAmpl;
037                this.yAmpl = yAmpl;
038        }
039
040        @Override
041        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
042                final double x = pnt.getX();
043                final double y = pnt.getY();
044                double xx = x + xAmpl * Math.sin(y / xWavel);
045                double yy = y + yAmpl * Math.sin(x / yWavel);
046                return PntDouble.from(xx, yy);
047        }
048}
049
